column5: Well, I got out for about 20 minutes today, and went 1/2!  Reason I was only out for 20 minutes...well I fell in while landing this 29 inch BEAUTY and wasnt wearing waders.  Here she is!  sit...SIT...STAY!       Yes, it is bleeding and did not have a chance to make it, the fish rolled about 20 times and I had to cut the line out of its gills. With the amount it was bleeding I knew there was no chance for it so I brought it home. Hes in the freezer for now, im not too sure what Im going to do with it but by leaving it we get into the whole "wasting a fish" regs business. I hate killing these fish but *hit happens. Picture is terrible quality, really is a pretty fish too.
WTG either way... 1/2 in 20 mins is alright... waiting for you to get a pic though
There ya go I see it now... WTG
Come to think of it, that kinda looks like a coho
Its the same  fish in both pictures... I know that quality is bad but it isnt THAT bad haha.  steelhead my friend.
Nice job Kemper!  I knew you'd start posting some great results as you got out more and more.  Congrats!

Thanks CC, Ive been trout fishin since a was knee high to a grasshopper but its always been with my dad, after the opener. Now that Im able to drive myself around its been a tough go last winter and this spring because fishing in the cold weather is (at least for me) a totally new sport. Wait till the water warms up and the season opens, then youll see some REAL results from me!  haha, tightlines
hopin to whack em tomorrow, good job bro.  waders next time.

Hey, nice fish! It's never good to see a fish die, but I know you didn't mean it. You could always make the fish into a wall decoration, or what ever you call it. I'm not really sure on how thats done, but you could look around.  Bryce
nice job bro!!! glad ya took swimming lessons as a kid now eh  lol
Nice catch, sorry bout the soggy socks...
